poem:
Title: "April's Austerity"

Through the downpour's cold decree,
Our wants dismissed for need.
Silent tills in tapestry towns,
Under the rain's relentless frown.

Splurge and spend - a memory doused,
Modesty now the merchant's spouse.
Knitted closely, the thrifty thread,
As Britannia bows her sodden head.

Beneath this liquid lacing veil,
Even clinking coins grow pale.
The high street hums a quieter song,
In the cast of caution's prolonged throng.
